message.content:
cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.TP, cs.FL, cs.SE

This paper deals with confluence of term rewriting systems, which is a topic in the area of logic and computation. Specifically, it focuses on conditional term rewriting systems, which are commonly studied in the subfield of automated theorem proving (cs.LO). The paper also discusses syntactic separation of symbols, which is a technique used in programming language theory (cs.PL). Additionally, the paper mentions the use of normalization restrictions, which is a topic in type theory and lambda calculus (cs.TP). The paper also discusses the idea of limited confluence, which is relevant to formal language theory (cs.FL). Finally, the paper presents practical criteria for confluence, which is relevant to software engineering (cs.SE).
